intro: Jacquemontia decumbens, commonly known as the creeping yellow vine, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its twining stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are alternate, heart-shaped, and often covered in fine hairs. Jacquemontia decumbens is typically found in moist, open habitats such as prairies and woodland edges.
